replies.body: play 10 yas games and post results
This is actually a fair challenge. But note I didn't say he was op I just said he was easy. I'll come back after I get ten games in.

he isn't easy, he has a lot of micro managing involved in his dashing and steel tempest timings... to maximize his output while minimizing the damage he takes 

speaking of his Q its hit box is really thin

Why Yas is OP is that he can _still_ oneshot/outduel your squishies with **just a Statikk Shiv** and **behind**.

Not saying that he's op (though I did use that word, oops), that's just how he works.
His skill is in how you micro his dash properly to minimize damage taken in lane and maximize poke. It's not easy. Trust me.

Let's be real
Yas is not hard but he ain't Darius or garen easy

Garen and Darius have to know when to ult at least. Yas just waits till he lands a skill shot (this can sometimes take a while as most Yas players pick him because they can't land skill shots) and then enjoy free kills.

Yo, I can fall asleep at the wheel and still perform competently with the two big guys, and until they make Yasuo tanky as hell in exchange for all of the mechanically-intensive parts of his kit, the same won't be true of him.
Yasuo isn't hard, but he has the highest death rate in the game for a reason
